intro: Coffea dybowskii, commonly known as the Dybowski coffee or the African coffee, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that contain the seeds used for coffee production. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value as well as its potential in coffee cultivation. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within the Coffea genus.
